Package game.view

Class Game4GewinnView

java.lang.Object
processing.core.PApplet
game.view.Game4GewinnView
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGame4GewinnView, processing.core.PConstants
public class Game4GewinnView extends processing.core.PApplet implements IGame4GewinnView
View class that contains all methods and variables that are shared by MainServer and MainClient. Use these view classes to start the game as server or client.
Author:
Yohanes Kirana

  • Method Details

    • newServer

      public static Game4GewinnView newServer()
      Register a display for server. This can not be changed later.
      Returns:
      View of the game for server.

    • newClient

      public static Game4GewinnView newClient()
      Register a display for client. This can not be changed later.
      Returns:
      View of the game for client.

      Set the window's size to 800x800px.

    • setup

      public void setup()
      Initialize controller from game.controller.Controller.java. Initialize all the text fields and button from library CP5. Change the window title according to view's role.
      Overrides:
      setup in class processing.core.PApplet

    • draw

      public void draw()
      Display the view according to state in controller.
      Overrides:
      draw in class processing.core.PApplet

    • drawStartGame

      public void drawStartGame()
      Display the title screen of the game depend on the role of the view. The player should insert port number if he plays as server and if he plays as client, he should insert port number and ip address. Need to be considered, that both port number are identical. Player then need to click start button to start game and change game state to game.
      Specified by:
      drawStartGame in interface IGame4GewinnView

    • drawGame

      public void drawGame()
      Display view of game state.
      Specified by:
      drawGame in interface IGame4GewinnView

    • drawSlot

      private void drawSlot()
      Draw 42 slot that will be used as board of the game. The slot will be change color according to player input.

    • drawText

      private void drawText()
      Draw a text to show player turn.

    • drawFooter

      private void drawFooter()
      Draw footer to display if the player play as server or client.

    • drawClientServerClosedMessage

      public void drawClientServerClosedMessage()
      Draw notification message that client or server has closed the game. User need to close the window and start over.
      Specified by:
      drawClientServerClosedMessage in interface IGame4GewinnView

    • drawFalsePortMessage

      public void drawFalsePortMessage()
      Draw notification message that user inserted false port or ip address. User need to close the window and start over.
      Specified by:
      drawFalsePortMessage in interface IGame4GewinnView

    • setWinner

      public void setWinner(int n)
      Set the winner of the game. This will be used to determine what to show on end game screen.
      Specified by:
      setWinner in interface IGame4GewinnView
      Parameters:
      n - Player identity, or 0 for no winner.
